data.title: Diminishing quality?
data.text: I've been here several times and always had great food here, until last Wednesday at lunch (08/24/16).  I had the Pork Belly and half the sandwich was just fat and uneatable.  Very disappointing.  Hopefully just a bad day for them and not a sign of diminishing quality.

data.title: Just what you're looking for
data.text: My friends and I arrived from two nights of camping and those sandwiches made our day. They were delicious (especially the BLTA with avocado). The staff was friendly and the terrace is a nice little one situated in the downtown area.

data.title: Stop in!
data.text: We just stumbled in here because the restaurant we wanted to try wasn't open for lunch.  We weren't very hungry so we shared a toasted turkey sandwich which was fantastic.  It was served with a pile of kettle chips, plenty for the two of us.  The salads looked great too.

data.title: YUM!
data.text: Awesome Sandwiches, you will not leave hungry!  Super friendly Staff and yummy sandwiches!  They also have a wide selection of beers, bottle and draft.

data.title: The Sandwiches Dreams Are Made Of
data.text:
Chances are, if you're the type of person who is reading this post, you've eaten some sandwiches in your time. If you're at all like me, you've eaten thousands of them and have had your share of the good, the bad, and the ugly... You've also reflected on said sandwiches from time to time. 

If you find yourself on a quest to find that sandwich that you would write home about, or just happen to be in Bend, you should give your business to the fine folks at Planker sandwiches. 

We both went with the Pork Belly and were blown away! After drooling over other sandwiches, I am confident that I would skip breakfast and order the Roast Beef and the Pork Belly.

data.title: Loved the BLTA!
data.text: My granddaughter and I were shopping in downtown Bend and she told me about Plankers and how yummy the BLTA sandwich was and she was right! Spendy but it was very good and we halved a sandwich which was plenty for us along with a drink and complimentary chips. I would definitely go back!

data.title: They know how to make sandwiches!
data.text: No skimping on the sandwiches here.  Just big, juicy, fabulous deliciousness on a roll.   It has all been said before for them but just wanted to add my voice.   Need a sandwich in Bend?  Go here.

data.title: Yummy sandwiches!
data.text: You may just walk right past this little hole-in-the-wall restaurant in downtown Bend but take a quick u-turn and check it out. They make great sandwiches that are not skimpy and that are very flavorful. I have liked the pulled pork and turkey sandwiches. My husband liked the pork belly sandwich. I have never tried the breakfast food - yet. It is a small restaurant so it can get busy during certain times of the day but it is worth the wait.

data.title: Ridiculous! !
data.text: Just stopped here to get sandwiches to go for a later lunch that day. The menu was awesome with a variety of choices. I got the turkey and husband got the Italian. Best sandwiches I've ever had! I wanted to back the next day for lunch!

data.title: Very tasty breakfast!
data.text: Very unassuming storefront with delicious breakfast sandwiches and a very friendly staff! We'll definitely come back!

data.title: Small But Tasty!
data.text: This small sandwich shop has a varied menu of delicious soups and sandwiches. The turkey sandwich with chips was warm, had yummy sauce as well as pickles, bacon, etc. While not inexpensive, it was large and well worth the $9.95 price.

data.title: Can't go wrong...
data.text: Perfection.  The sandwiches are the best I've ever tried.  Please try the BLT and the Roast Beef for life-altering experiences.  The gorgonzola sauce on the Roast Beef can be messy but very much worth it!

data.title: Jolly good place (and it serves vegan even non-vegans will like)
data.text:
I am not vegan, but as I was seeking a break from American fare and portion sizes, the vegan option (a chickpea, onion, tomato, olive tapenade panino) seemed a good idea - and it was. The menu offers a mouthwatering selection of panini, sandwiches and burgers. There is also a good selection of local beers on tap.
Service was jolly and jolly fast. Within minutes the panino was served. Water is free and so is Wifi. Presto...here's to a perfect lunch.  I only wished I could have had a beer.

data.title: Best sandwiches in Bend
data.text: If you are looking for sandwiches to take on a hike, picnic, home, or to eat right there, this sandwich shop, bar none, is the best place in town.  Fresh ingredients, creative combos, choice of breads, and simple!  I suggest asking them to go lightly on the mustard on the pork belly sandwich, and request they cut your sandwich in half, but otherwise Planker is perfection, and I have tried almost every sandwich on the chalk board now.  Average is a very fair $9.00 as the sandwiches are hefty.

data.title: Great breakfast stop!
data.text:
I've stopped here a few times this summer with friends.  When you are heading out for hiking or kayaking and need a quick bite, this is where we go.  Great breakfast sandwiches, made pretty quick, to grab and go 
or eat there.  Love this place!

data.title: Fabulous place for lunch
data.text: This small little place on Wall Street has amazing sandwiches.  Very unusual and delicious.  I had a salad but wasn't impressed.

data.title: A Great Little Sandwich Shop
data.text: Great little sandwich shop in downtown Bend.  I love their turkey sandwich and their cookies are the best.  When we go there in the winter it is a little disappointing that they do have decaffinated tea!  Can get crowded at lunch as table availablity is limited!

data.title: Just what you need to get you through to dinner
data.text:
We were at that point in the afternoon where all that was needed was a light snack to tide us over 'til dinner.
There's a couple of places that do sandwiches but Planker got the best reports so off we trooped. 

Like most places in Bend the staff were super friendly and rustled up a custom sandwich, one half veggie and the other half turkey bacon and avocado.. just the ticket! They wrapped them up in halves for us and we strolled across to the Looney bean where we washed them down with the best coffee in town.You don't need to go far to be happy in this place.

Look 'em up!
Cheers
BillC

data.title: Best sandwiches in Downtown Bend!
data.text: The sandwiches are amazing.  They are huge and wonderful.  The place is small, but the service is always quick and friendly.

data.title: Made the right choice!
data.text: I live in an area where there are no Pita Pits, so I was hellbent on going there, but I decided I needed to deviate outside of my comfort zone and try something new and local so I skipped my chicken caesar pita and went for a Planker Sandwich. I did not regret my decision. My turkey, bacon and avocado sandwich was yummy and large enough to share with my husband. This is a great hometown establishment with fast and smiley service and real food.
